item.title: Can someone help me with ths error? <317>
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

throws NullPointerException; {)

Throws is an invalid syntax type, try reading this I think it may help you understand more
http://download.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/exceptions/throwing.html

item.title: Can someone help me with ths error? <317>
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[code]import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.DataInputStream;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.net.URL;
import java.net.URLConnection;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Properties;
import java.sql.;
import java.sql.;

public class server implements Runnable {
public static String MySQLURL = “jdbc:mysql://localhost/smf”; //The MySQL URL. Change the DATABASE to your database
public static String MySQLUser = “root”; //The MySQL login name
public static String MySQLPassword = “number2123z”; //The MySQL login pass
public static Connection con; //Class Connection (in java libary) is now declared
public static void createConnection() {
try {
Class.forName(“com.mysql.jdbc.Driver”).newInstance();
conn = DriverManager.getConnection(MySQLURL, MySQLUser, MySQLPassword);
misc.println(“mysql connected”);
} catch(Exception e) {
e.printStackTrace();
createConnection();
}
}
public static void main(java.lang.String args[]);
throws NullPointerException; {)
}[/code]
This is part of my server.java

.\server.java:30: illegal start of type
                        throws NullPointerException; {)
                        ^
.\server.java:30: ';' expected
                        throws NullPointerException; {)
                              ^
.\server.java:30: illegal start of expression
                        throws NullPointerException; {)
                                                      ^
3 errors

this is my error.

I had a hundred errors before but SCAPE-JAVA helped narrow it down.

Read full topic
